passages.text: Friday, 29 August 2025
Top Call | Asia | CEEMEA | Latin America | Nontan | Western Europe | Key Rating and Target Price Changes
Han's Laser Technology (002008.SZ) - 2025- 26E Likely a "Super" Cycle Led by AI PCB and Apple; Raise TP to Rmb45.0

While we cut 2025E earnings forecast for Han's Laser (HL) by \(7\%\) to reflect its loss- making new energy equipment, we increase our 2026E number by \(23\%\) as we raise revenue for both PCB and IT equipment (mainly for Apple) as mgmt. sees strong PCB drilling and testing equipment demand from PCB makers for AI server/datacenter, such as Victory Giant Technology (VGT; 300476. SZ, covered by Karen Huang), and strong order growth from Apple supply chain, driven by iPhone 18 - potentially Apple's first foldable phone. We lift target price by \(- 61\%\) to Rmb45.0, based on \(39x1 - yr\) fwd P/E as we expect an IT and PCB equipment "super" cycle to drive a \(49\%\) core profit CAGR in 2025- 26E and lead to stock rerating for HL, similar to what we saw in 2017 - spec upgrades of iPhone 8/X from 7 led to capex upcycle.
OCBC (OCBC.SI) What's New from Citi ASEAN C- Suite Corporate Day: Focus on growing capital light income

We hosted OCBC's CFO at our conference. Themes: [1] GEH opportunity with new CEO Greg Hingston appointed in Aug- 24 focusing on higher margins products and cross- selling opportunities. 1H25 TWNS - 27%yoy but NBEV +16%yoy. Increasing product solutions to HNW customers in the private bank. Tapping OCBC customer

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

base for cross- selling: \(70\%\) of GEH customers hold OCBC products but just \(30\%\) of OCBC customers have GEH policies. [2] Wealth management. Jul- 23 update (link) indicated new RM hires and likely have turned productive (typically takes 12- 18 months), which benefited 2Q25 wealth fees and NNM inflows. Investments to simplify AML processes for NNM. New solutions (link) to drive higher wealth activities and wealth continuum under one- group strategy. [3] Increased SG mortgage market share using GEH solutions to incentivise property agents to refer OCBC mortgage packages (link). RoW loans \(+10\%\) driven...

Mindray reported 1H25 rev. of Rmb16.74bn \((- 18\%\) yoy) and net profit of Rmb5.07bn \((- 33\%\) yoy), missing VA consensus on a high base - well anticipated by investors. Mgmt guided for a strong 2H recovery, with domestic rev. growth expected to turn positive in 3Q25. Mgmt maintained \(10 - 15\%\) yoy full- year growth guidance for overseas rev. in FY25. The company also proposed a second interim dividend, bringing the 1H25 payout ratio to a generous \(65\%\) , signaling confidence.
Mindray's 1H25 rev. breakdown by region and potential growth driver ahead for each market

We initiated on Emaar Properties with a Buy rating in Jun'25 as we expected the strong UAE properties momentum from 2024/1Q25 to persist despite the ongoing concerns around oversupply in the real estate market. Emaar's stock price is up c.8.5% oy the past three months, as the developer reported robust operating trends for 2Q25. We believe recent trends could continue in the M.T. Reiterate Buy. New TP AED 18.50. We also close a short- term catalyst watch opened into 2Q reporting.
Rahubajaj, CFA | Nitesh Agarwal
Pubai Property Sector Trends - 2.2% Increase Jun- Aug'25 Average Sales Price vs. That in Mar- May'25. Sales Volumes up 12.2% During the Same Period
Emaar Properties - We Expect AED 1.1/sh DPS in 2025 Further Growing to AED 1.20/sh in 2026
Talabat (TALABAT.DU) - Up to Neutral as Risk/Reward More Balanced; TP Maintained

With Talabat's shares down \(20\%\) in the last 3 months, underperforming DFMGI by 30pp (u/p by \(\sim 50pp\) since IPO in Dec- 24), we see current valuations fairly reflecting a more competitive environment. The key catalysts flagged in our initiation have largely played out: we saw Keeta's expansion to Talabat's markets (Qatar launched, UAE/Kuwait likely coming soon); Talabat started to revise its margin guidance after 2Q25 (FY25 guidance implies \(\sim 0.5pp\) margin decline in 2H25 vs. 1H25); the market is now pricing \(\sim 4.5 - 5\%\) LT EBITDA/GMV margin, in line with our expectations. Our estimates and AED1.2 TP are unchanged, now implying a positive TSR, hence we upgrade the stock to Neutral. We also provide key takeaways from Meituan's 2Q25 profit warning and DHER's 2Q25 results.
Talabat's shares have underperformed
We think the market is pricing 4.5- 5% LT EBITDA margin at 11.5- 12% WACC

With the September 7 PBA elections and October mid- term election getting closer, the risk aversion has materially increased despite available polls suggesting the government may increase their seats in the midterms, although polls are also getting narrower specially at the Province of Buenos Aires (PBA). We focus our monthly on how the market has performed in previous elections cycles, and the potential scenarios.
Andrés Cardona | Brian Flores, CFA | Renata Cabral | Ernesto Revilla | Ivan Riveros, CFA Even the lower confidence level could suggest a \(>40\%\) vote in October
Brazil Payments - Recalibrating Estimates as Volumes Momentum Slows

We are updating estimates after 2Q for STNE and PAGS, increasing STNE TP to US \(\) 18.0\(from US\) \ \(17.0\) and decreasing PAGS TP to US \(\) 9.0\(from US\) \ \(10.0\) . We are introducing a downside Catalyst Watch on PAGS, due to weak op. expectations for 3Q. However, we see an attractive div yield of \(18\%\) for the next 12M, implying total upside potential of \(23\%\) . STNE remains our preference, as we believe it has a clearer growth trajectory in the next years, though we continue to be (conservatively) below its '27 guidance. Also, STNE should deliver a \(10\%\) div yield in the next 12 months, partly due to business divestment, supporting the \(23\%\) ETR.
Gustavo Schroden | Arnon Shirazi, CFA | Brian Flores, CFA

MRVL stock was - 11% after reporting results/guide in- line with Street and our preview adjusting for the \(\sim\) 60M auto ethernet divestment. However, data center biz was modestly below expectations due to optics timing and was guided flat below Citi/Street \(+5\%\) qq expectations due to lumpiness in the ASIC sales spooking investor concerns on potential share shifts in the Trainium program. We view MRVL's DC comments as customer concentration driven and not a broad read on the AI demand. Management's comments on record XPU/XPU attach design

momentum indicates no major share shifts at its XPU customers. We adjust our CY25/26 EPS \(- 1\% / - 5\%\) on lower gross margins due to higher ASIC mix and reduce TP to \(\) 92\(on consistent 27x P/E times revised CY26 EPS of\) \ \(3.39\) . We expect the stock to recover going into Citi's Global TMT conference where we host the management for a fireside chat on 9/3. Maintain Buy.

Ayvens produced strong Q2 25 results. We have updated our model and forecasts accordingly. Results benefited from solid and stable leasing ad services margins, and stronger than expected (ICE) used car sales gains. Ayvens seems on- track to meet its FY26 targets, apart from the \(6\%\) CAGR in earnings assets. Further, the recent UK Motor Finance Commission judgement reduces risks of new UK provisions. However, after a near- \(60\%\) rally from the lows in late 2024, and with the shares now trading above our TP based on 0.7x price to book value, we believe that the risk- reward is now more balanced - with EU car sales demand slowing, with the potential for weakening EU used car residuals, and with potential volatility in French credit markets. We downgrade to Neutral, but keep our TP at €9.50.
Harald C Hendrikse | Ross MacDonald | Soumava Banerjee  Bull/Bear: Ayvens SA (AYV.PA)

Porsche reported what we hope will be a 25- year trough EBIT margin of \(2.6\%\) in Q2 \(25 (> 10\%\) ex "exceptionals") - taking the FY25E EBIT margin guide to \(5\% - 7\%\) - including tariff impacts at \(15\%\) . We think quarterly EBIT margins improve from here on lower (not zero) exceptionals, and FY26E/FY27E/FY28E margins improve on reduced exceptionals / reduced fixed costs / new model demand. Whilst Porsche shares arguably never fully reflected trough EPS, we think any clear evidence of a slow but sustained EBIT margin recovery would drive a recovery in demand for Porsche shares. Remains Buy rated.
Harald C Hendrikse | Ross MacDonald | Sounava Banerjee

Renault reported sharply improved July sales at 182k, up 17k yoy - over \(10\%\) yoy. This follows the June sales which were down 10k units. This was achieved despite still very weak French sales in July \((- 8\%)\) and continued LCV weakness. If these months sales had been reversed (adding \(\sim 25k\) units to 1H 25), then we believe that the recent small margin guidance cut could have been avoided - although negative EU pricing remains a headwind. Either way, given very low expectations, and consensual positioning, these figures were enough to give the shorts a scare pushing the shares up \(\sim 5\%\) . Whilst we understand investor scepticism on 2H 25 EBIT margin improvement, our continued Buy rating rests on the fact that 1: RNO has realistic reasons why 2H 25 could be better than 1H; and 2: RNO shares still seem very oversold. Remains Buy, but we reduce our TP to €42 (from €44).
Harald C Hendrikse | Ross MacDonald | Sounava Banerjee  Renault share price and Bloomberg EPS consensus

Source: Citi Research

If you are visually impaired and would like to speak to a Citi representative regarding the details of the graphics in this document, please call USA 1- 888- 500- 5008 (TTY: 711), from outside the US +1- 210- 677- 3788

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient

valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "- " and "- " respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
Any price(s) of instruments mentioned in recommendations are as of the prior day's market close on the primary market for the instrument, unless otherwise stated.

The completion and first dissemination of any recommendations made within this research report are as of the Eastern date- time displayed at the top of the Product. If the Product references views of other analysts then please refer to the price chart or rating history table for the date/time of completion and first dissemination with respect to that view.

Regulations in various jurisdictions require that where a recommendation differs from any of the author's previous recommendations concerning the same financial instrument or issuer that has been published during the preceding 12- month period that the change(s) and the date of that previous recommendation are indicated. For fundamental coverage please refer to the price chart or rating change history within this disclosure appendix or the issuer disclosure summary at https://www.citvlicotcity.com/cvr/ppublic/citi_research_disclosures.

Citi Research has implemented policies for identifying, considering and managing potential conflicts of interest arising as a result of publication or distribution of investment research. A description of these policies can be found at https://www.citvlicotcity.com/cvr/ppublic/citi_research_disclosures.

The proportion of all Citi Research research recommendations that were the equivalent to "Buy", "Hold", "Sell" at the end of each quarter over the prior 12 months (with the % of these that had received investment firm services from Citi in the prior 12 months shown in brackets) is as follows: Q2 2025 Buy 33% (63%), Hold 44% (51%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.4% (86%); Q1 2025 Buy 33% (63%), Hold 44% (51%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.5% (87%); Q4 2024 Buy 32% (64%), Hold 44% (52%), Sell 23% (44%), RV 0.4% (92%); Q3 2024 Buy 33% (61%), Hold 44% (52%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.4% (80%). For the purposes of disclosing recommendations other than for equity (whose definitions can be found in the corresponding disclosure sections), "Buy" means a positive directional trade idea; "Sell" means a negative directional trade idea; and "Relative Value" means any trade idea which does not have a clear direction to the investment strategy.

European regulations require a 5 year price history when past performance of a security is referenced. CitiVelocity's Charting Tool (https://www.citvlicotcity.com/cv2/#go/CHARTING_3_Equities) provides the facility to create customisable price charts including a five year option. This tool can be found in the Data & Analytics section under any of the asset class menus in CitiVelocity (https://www.citvlicotcity.com/). For further information contact CitiVelocity support (https://www.citvlicotcity.com/cv2/go/CLIENT_SUPPORT). The source for all referenced prices, unless otherwise stated, is DataCentral, which sources price information from Thomson Reuters. Past performance is not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future results. Forecasts are not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future performance.

Citi Research broadly and simultaneously disseminates its research content to the Firm's institutional and retail clients via the Firm's proprietary electronic distribution platforms (e.g., Citi Velocity and various Global Wealth platforms). As a convenience, certain, but not all, research content may be distributed through third party aggregators. Clients may receive published research reports by email, on a discretionary basis, and only after such research content has been broadly disseminated. Certain research is made available only to institutional investors to satisfy regulatory requirements. The level and types of services provided by Citi Research analysts to clients may vary depending on various factors such as the client's individual preferences as to the frequency and manner of receiving communications from analysts, the client's risk profile and investment focus and perspective (e.g. market- wide, sector specific, long term, short- term etc.), the size and scope of the overall client relationship with the Firm and legal and regulatory constraints.

Pursuant to Comissão de Valores Mobiliários Resolução 20 and ASIC Regulatory Guide 264, Citi is required to disclose whether a Citi related company or business has a commercial relationship with the subject company. Considering that Citi operates multiple businesses in more than 100 countries around the world, it is likely that Citi has a commercial relationship with the subject company.

Citi Research may provide different research products and services to different classes of customers (for example, based upon long- term or short- term investment horizons) that may lead to differing conclusions or recommendations that could impact the price of a security contrary to the recommendations in the alternative research product, provided that each is consistent with the rating system for each respective product.
